subsections.title: Welcome Letter
subsections.content: A personal note from the CEO or company leader, expressing gratitude and excitement for the new employee joining the team.

subsections.title: Company Overview
subsections.content: A brief history of the company, its mission, vision, and core values. This helps employees understand the bigger picture and their role within the organization.

subsections.title: Employment Classifications
subsections.content: Defines different types of employment (full-time, part-time, exempt, non-exempt) and their respective benefits and responsibilities.

subsections.title: Overtime Policies
subsections.content: Explains how overtime is calculated and compensated, in accordance with labor laws.

subsections.title: Attendance and Punctuality
subsections.content: Sets expectations for regular attendance, punctuality, and procedures for reporting absences.

subsections.title: Employment At-Will
subsections.content: Clarifies that employment is voluntary and can be terminated by either the employee or the employer at any time, with or without cause.

subsections.title: Equal Opportunity and Anti-Harassment
subsections.content: Outlines the company's commitment to providing a workplace free from discrimination and harassment, including procedures for reporting and addressing complaints.

subsections.title: Work Authorization
subsections.content: Details the requirements for legal work authorization, such as completing an I-9 form.

subsections.title: Code of Conduct
subsections.content: Describes expected professional behavior, including ethical standards and conflict of interest policies.

subsections.title: Dress Code
subsections.content: Provides guidelines on appropriate workplace attire, which may vary by role or department.

subsections.title: Use of Company Property
subsections.content: Rules for using company equipment, internet, and other resources responsibly.

subsections.title: Salary and Wages
subsections.content: Information on pay periods, direct deposit, and how salaries are determined.

subsections.title: Benefits Overview
subsections.content: Details on health insurance, retirement plans, and other employee benefits.

subsections.title: Leave Policies
subsections.content: Information on various types of leave, such as sick leave, vacation, and parental leave, including how to request and use them.

subsections.title: Workplace Safety
subsections.content: Guidelines for maintaining a safe work environment, including reporting hazards and following safety protocols.

subsections.title: Accident Reporting
subsections.content: Procedures for reporting workplace injuries or accidents.

subsections.title: Emergency Procedures
subsections.content: Instructions for what to do in case of emergencies, such as fire or natural disasters.

subsections.title: Acceptable Use Policy
subsections.content: Rules for using company technology, including computers, email, and internet access.

subsections.title: Social Media Guidelines
subsections.content: Expectations for employees' use of social media, both personally and professionally, to protect the company's reputation.

subsections.title: Performance Evaluations
subsections.content: The process for regular performance reviews, including criteria and frequency.

subsections.title: Training and Development
subsections.content: Opportunities for professional growth, such as training programs, workshops, and tuition reimbursement.

subsections.title: Promotion Policies
subsections.content: Criteria and procedures for career advancement within the company.

subsections.title: Addressing Misconduct
subsections.content: Steps for handling employee misconduct, including verbal and written warnings.

subsections.title: Disciplinary Actions
subsections.content: Possible consequences for violations of company policies, up to and including termination.

subsections.title: Appeal Process
subsections.content: How employees can appeal disciplinary decisions if they believe they were unjust.

subsections.title: Resignation Procedures
subsections.content: Guidelines for providing notice and the process for leaving the company.

subsections.title: Termination Policies
subsections.content: Conditions under which an employee may be terminated and the procedures followed.

subsections.title: Exit Interviews
subsections.content: The purpose and process of exit interviews to gather feedback from departing employees.
